Description: allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted document, aka "microsoft office/wordpad remote code execution vulnerability w/windows api."
microsoft edge and internet explorer have a type confusion vulnerability in mshtml.dll, which allows remote code execution.
use-after-free vulnerability in microsoft internet explorer allows remote attackers to execute code.
oleaut32.dll in ole in microsoft windows allows remote attackers to remotely execute code via a crafted web site.
this vulnerability may corrupt memory in a way that could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user within internet explorer.
apache struts versions 2.3 to 2.3.34 and 2.5 to 2.5.16 contain a vulnerability which can allow for remote code execution.

the smbv1 server allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted packets, aka "windows smb remote code execution vulnerability." this vulnerability is different from those described in cve-2017-0144, cve-2017-0145, cve-2017-0146, and cve-2017-0148.
